snippet: William F. Boyland Jr. and his chief of staff, who also pleaded not guilty, were accused of soliciting and accepting thousands of dollars in bribes from undercover agents.
abstract: New York State Assemblyman William F Boyland Jr, Brooklyn Democrat, pleads not guilty to charges of soliciting and accepting thousands of dollars in bribes from undercover federal agents; Boyland's chief of staff, Ry-Ann Hermon, also pleads not guilty.
lead_paragraph: William F. Boyland Jr. and his chief of staff, who also pleaded not guilty, were accused of soliciting and accepting thousands of dollars in bribes from undercover agents.

headline.seo: Boyland Pleads Not Guilty to Latest Bribery Charges
headline.main: Brooklyn Legislator Pleads Not Guilty in Latest Bribery Case
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Legislator Pleads Not Guilty in Latest Bribery Case
